review_blob: Dark amber/copper with a nice lasting head. Caramel aroma. Taste is fairly typical IPA, maybe a little more caramel and a nice finish. Good body and mouthfeel. Not my favorite, but not bad at all.
Pleasant aroma of pine and herbs. Clear, golden color with a minimal white head. Nice medium bitterness. Livelier carbonation than I expected from the appearance.
aroma of pine and citrus. pale, golden color with a thick white foamy long lasting head. Medium hoppiness. Nice crisp texture with a long hoppy finish.
Strong pineapple aroma. Nice, long lastinig white head. Great citrus flavor nicely balanced with the IPA bitterness. Crisp, lively palate with a long, hoppy finish.
Lovely butterscotch aroma. Dark color with a small tan head. Medium body, creamy, long finish. Nicely balanced. The coffee and chocolate flavors are strong but not at all overpowering.
pleasant, citrus aroma. hazy pale golden color with a very minimal white head. Medium tart/sour. Light bodied and slightly less carbonated than I expected. Not really my thing, but not bad either.
citrus, herbs, amber, hazy, white foam, medium bitterness, creamy, average carbonation, slight bitter finish.
citrus, herbs, golden, hazy, minimal head, white foam, medium bitterness, citrus. Not my favorite, but quite refreshing and easy to drink.
toast, roasty, dark, hazy, minimal head, light sweetness, light body, average carbonation
citrus, herbs, pale golden color, sparkling, minimal head, medium sourness, medium sourness, light body, thin feel, lively carbonation,
Slightly hazy, golden color with a small but perfect frothy, long-lasting white head and lacing. Nice citrusy, hoppy aroma. Medium body and carbonation. Long finish.
beer_name: Boulevard Tasting Room Series Mid-Coast IPA
